intro: Protea alpina, commonly known as the Alpine Protea, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Proteaceae family and is characterized by its showy, cone-shaped inflorescence. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils at high altitudes. Its flowers are usually pink or white, with a distinctive central style that resembles a brush. Protea alpina is adapted to cool, moist environments and is often found in mountainous regions.
